intro: Tylophora tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly tylophora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape and often have a velvety texture. Tylophora tomentosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
